plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small, early-blooming perennial bulb known for its bright and vibrant flowers that emerge through snow in late winter to early spring, signaling the end of the cold season.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe and North America (cultivated)
plants.funFact: Crocuses are one of the first flowers to bloom in spring and have been cultivated since ancient times for their beauty and for saffron in related species.

plants.name: Prunus mume
plants.description: A deciduous tree producing fragrant, delicate blossoms that appear in late winter, often before its leaves emerge, widely celebrated in East Asian cultures for its beauty and symbolism of resilience.
plants.funFact: Ume blossoms are often featured in traditional poetry and art symbolizing endurance and hope during the cold winter months.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: An evergreen perennial that blooms in late winter, producing elegant white flowers that sometimes have a greenish tinge, popular in shade gardens for winter interest.
plants.location: European mountainous regions and cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, it is not a true rose and has been used medicinally in Europe since medieval times.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing tree known for its fluffy, bright yellow flowers that bloom profusely in late winter and early spring, widely planted as an ornamental and used in floristry.
plants.location: Native to southeastern Australia; cultivated in Mediterranean climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Its golden flowers are celebrated in the Mimosa Festival in Italy every February, symbolizing female strength and respect.
